At-a-Glance: Urban yards succeed on soft skills: proactive neighbour comms, clear signage, tidy kit, and swift complaint handling.
Why it Matters: Perception drives permissions. One sting incident or messy yard can shutter multiple sites.
Step-by-Step: Pre-site checklist (access, water, shade, flight paths). Written agreement with landlord. Welcome sheet to neighbours with hornet/reporting info and beekeeper contact. Office-hours inspections. Incident log and escalation pathway.

Common Pitfalls: Open feeding, wide entrances near walkways, and unannounced swarm management visits.
Tools & Materials: Site risk assessment template, laminated signage, waterers, robbing screens.
Further Reading & Sources: Urban beekeeping codes of practice; local council guidance.
